channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: PLLaVA : Parameter-free LLaVA Extension from Images to Videos for Video Dense Captioning
item.description: PLLaVA achieves new state-of-the-art performance on modern benchmark datasets for both video question-answer and captioning tasks.

item.title: Vision-based robot manipulation of transparent liquid containers in a laboratory setting
item.description: Laboratory processes involving small volumes of solutions and active ingredients are often performed manually due to challenges in automation, such as high initial costs, semi-structured environments and protocol variability.

item.title: History repeats itself: A Baseline for Temporal Knowledge Graph Forecasting
item.description: Temporal Knowledge Graph (TKG) Forecasting aims at predicting links in Knowledge Graphs for future timesteps based on a history of Knowledge Graphs.

item.title: Interpreting Answers to Yes-No Questions in Dialogues from Multiple Domains
item.description: People often answer yes-no questions without explicitly saying yes, no, or similar polar keywords.

item.title: TinyChart: Efficient Chart Understanding with Visual Token Merging and Program-of-Thoughts Learning
item.description: Charts are important for presenting and explaining complex data relationships.

item.title: Subset SSD for enhanced indexation with sector constraints
item.description: In our approach, subset SSD, the portfolio associated with each sector is treated in a SSD manner.

item.title: SEED-Bench-2-Plus: Benchmarking Multimodal Large Language Models with Text-Rich Visual Comprehension
item.description: We hope that our work can serve as a valuable addition to existing MLLM benchmarks, providing insightful observations and inspiring further research in the area of text-rich visual comprehension with MLLMs.

item.title: PILA: A Historical-Linguistic Dataset of Proto-Italic and Latin
item.description: To assist historical linguists in the study of Italic sound change, we introduce the Proto-Italic to Latin (PILA) dataset, which consists of roughly 3, 000 pairs of forms from Proto-Italic and Latin.

item.title: CoCoG: Controllable Visual Stimuli Generation based on Human Concept Representations
item.description: Generating visual stimuli with controlling concepts is the key.

item.title: Efficient Higher-order Convolution for Small Kernels in Deep Learning
item.description: Conceptional convolution, a linear filter, is the essential component of DCNNs while nonlinear convolution is generally implemented as higher-order Volterra filters, However, for Volterra filtering, significant memory and computational costs pose a primary limitation for its widespread application in DCNN applications.

item.title: Incorporating Lexical and Syntactic Knowledge for Unsupervised Cross-Lingual Transfer
item.description: In this paper, we present a novel framework called "Lexicon-Syntax Enhanced Multilingual BERT" that combines both lexical and syntactic knowledge.

item.title: Multi-Scale Representations by Varying Window Attention for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: VWA leverages the local window attention (LWA) and disentangles LWA into the query window and context window, allowing the context's scale to vary for the query to learn representations at multiple scales.

item.title: Make Your LLM Fully Utilize the Context
item.description: While many contemporary large language models (LLMs) can process lengthy input, they still struggle to fully utilize information within the long context, known as the lost-in-the-middle challenge.

item.title: Latent Modulated Function for Computational Optimal Continuous Image Representation
item.description: To tackle this problem, we propose a novel Latent Modulated Function (LMF), which decouples the HR-HD decoding process into shared latent decoding in LR-HD space and independent rendering in HR Low-Dimensional (LD) space, thereby realizing the first computational optimal paradigm of continuous image representation.

item.title: Learning-Based Efficient Approximation of Data-enabled Predictive Control
item.description: However, the size of the optimization problem in DeePC grows linearly with respect to the data size, which prohibits its application due to high computational costs.

item.title: Asking and Answering Questions to Extract Event-Argument Structures
item.description: Transformer-based questions are generated using large language models trained to formulate questions based on a passage and the expected answer.

item.title: Continual Learning of Large Language Models: A Comprehensive Survey
item.description: In this survey, we provide a comprehensive overview of the current research progress on LLMs within the context of CL.

item.title: COBRA -- COnfidence score Based on shape Regression Analysis for method-independent quality assessment of object pose estimation from single images
item.description: We present a generic algorithm for scoring pose estimation methods that rely on single image semantic analysis.

item.title: Boosting Unsupervised Semantic Segmentation with Principal Mask Proposals
item.description: Unsupervised semantic segmentation aims to automatically partition images into semantically meaningful regions by identifying global categories within an image corpus without any form of annotation.

item.title: Learning Visuotactile Skills with Two Multifingered Hands
item.description: Two significant challenges exist: the lack of an affordable and accessible teleoperation system suitable for a dual-arm setup with multifingered hands, and the scarcity of multifingered hand hardware equipped with touch sensing.

item.title: OmniSearchSage: Multi-Task Multi-Entity Embeddings for Pinterest Search
item.description: In this paper, we present OmniSearchSage, a versatile and scalable system for understanding search queries, pins, and products for Pinterest search.

item.title: How Far Are We to GPT-4V? Closing the Gap to Commercial Multimodal Models with Open-Source Suites
item.description: Compared to both open-source and proprietary models, InternVL 1. 5 shows competitive performance, achieving state-of-the-art results in 8 of 18 benchmarks.

item.title: SFMViT: SlowFast Meet ViT in Chaotic World
item.description: The task of spatiotemporal action localization in chaotic scenes is a challenging task toward advanced video understanding.

item.title: WorldValuesBench: A Large-Scale Benchmark Dataset for Multi-Cultural Value Awareness of Language Models
item.description: The awareness of multi-cultural human values is critical to the ability of language models (LMs) to generate safe and personalized responses.

item.title: Global Concept Explanations for Graphs by Contrastive Learning
item.description: Overall, our results show promising capability to extract the underlying structure-property relationships for complex graph property prediction tasks.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning with Generative Models for Compact Support Sets
item.description: In this work, we propose a framework utilizing reinforcement learning as a control for foundation models, allowing for the granular generation of small, focused synthetic support sets to augment the performance of neural network models on real data classification tasks.

item.title: Training-Free Unsupervised Prompt for Vision-Language Models
item.description: In light of this, we propose Training-Free Unsupervised Prompts (TFUP), which maximally preserves the inherent representation capabilities and enhances them with a residual connection to similarity-based prediction probabilities in a training-free and labeling-free manner.

item.title: Multi-scale HSV Color Feature Embedding for High-fidelity NIR-to-RGB Spectrum Translation
item.description: The NIR-to-RGB spectral domain translation is a formidable task due to the inherent spectral mapping ambiguities within NIR inputs and RGB outputs.

item.title: ProbGate at EHRSQL 2024: Enhancing SQL Query Generation Accuracy through Probabilistic Threshold Filtering and Error Handling
item.description: Recently, deep learning-based language models have significantly enhanced text-to-SQL tasks, with promising applications in retrieving patient records within the medical domain.

item.title: SwarmRL: Building the Future of Smart Active Systems
item.description: This work introduces SwarmRL, a Python package designed to study intelligent active particles.

item.title: LLM-Based Section Identifiers Excel on Open Source but Stumble in Real World Applications
item.description: Electronic health records (EHR) even though a boon for healthcare practitioners, are growing convoluted and longer every day.

item.title: 3D Face Modeling via Weakly-supervised Disentanglement Network joint Identity-consistency Prior
item.description: Generative 3D face models featuring disentangled controlling factors hold immense potential for diverse applications in computer vision and computer graphics.

item.title: List Items One by One: A New Data Source and Learning Paradigm for Multimodal LLMs
item.description: Set-of-Mark (SoM) Prompting unleashes the visual grounding capability of GPT-4V, by enabling the model to associate visual objects with tags inserted on the image.

item.title: Canonical Decision Diagrams Modulo Theories
item.description: In this paper, we present a novel very-general technique to leverage DDs to SMT level, which has several advantages: it is very easy to implement on top of an AllSMT solver and a DD package, which are used as blackboxes; it works for every form of DDs and every theory, or combination thereof, supported by the AllSMT solver; it produces theory-canonical T-DDs if the propositional DD is canonical.

item.title: TokenHMR: Advancing Human Mesh Recovery with a Tokenized Pose Representation
item.description: We address the problem of regressing 3D human pose and shape from a single image, with a focus on 3D accuracy.

item.title: EmoVIT: Revolutionizing Emotion Insights with Visual Instruction Tuning
item.description: Visual Instruction Tuning represents a novel learning paradigm involving the fine-tuning of pre-trained language models using task-specific instructions.

item.title: ReZero: Boosting MCTS-based Algorithms by Just-in-Time and Speedy Reanalyze
item.description: MCTS-based algorithms, such as MuZero and its derivatives, have achieved widespread success in various decision-making domains.

item.title: AAPL: Adding Attributes to Prompt Learning for Vision-Language Models
item.description: Through our experiments, we have identified important issues in CoOp and CoCoOp: the context learned through traditional image augmentation is biased toward seen classes, negatively impacting generalization to unseen classes.

item.title: Modeling Selective Feature Attention for Representation-based Siamese Text Matching
item.description: Representation-based Siamese networks have risen to popularity in lightweight text matching due to their low deployment and inference costs.

item.title: Efficient Solution of Point-Line Absolute Pose
item.description: We revisit certain problems of pose estimation based on 3D--2D correspondences between features which may be points or lines.

item.title: Cross-sensor super-resolution of irregularly sampled Sentinel-2 time series
item.description: Satellite imaging generally presents a trade-off between the frequency of acquisitions and the spatial resolution of the images.

item.title: A Multi-objective Optimization Benchmark Test Suite for Real-time Semantic Segmentation
item.description: To bridge the gap, we introduce a tailored streamline to transform the task of HW-NAS for real-time semantic segmentation into standard MOPs.

item.title: PAD: Patch-Agnostic Defense against Adversarial Patch Attacks
item.description: Adversarial patch attacks present a significant threat to real-world object detectors due to their practical feasibility.

item.title: Deep learning-based blind image super-resolution with iterative kernel reconstruction and noise estimation
item.description: Yet, there is a gap in the literature to provide a well-generalized deep learning-based solution that performs well on images with unknown and highly complex degradations.

item.title: DAVE -- A Detect-and-Verify Paradigm for Low-Shot Counting
item.description: DAVE outperforms the top density-based counters by ~20% in the total count MAE, it outperforms the most recent detection-based counter by ~20% in detection quality and sets a new state-of-the-art in zero-shot as well as text-prompt-based counting.

item.title: Weak-to-Strong Extrapolation Expedites Alignment
item.description: Suppose we have a moderately trained LLM (e. g., trained to align with human preference) in hand, can we further exploit its potential and cheaply acquire a stronger model?

item.title: ConsistentID: Portrait Generation with Multimodal Fine-Grained Identity Preserving
item.description: ConsistentID comprises two key components: a multimodal facial prompt generator that combines facial features, corresponding facial descriptions and the overall facial context to enhance precision in facial details, and an ID-preservation network optimized through the facial attention localization strategy, aimed at preserving ID consistency in facial regions.

item.title: Self-Balanced R-CNN for Instance Segmentation
item.description: Current state-of-the-art two-stage models on instance segmentation task suffer from several types of imbalances.

item.title: Formal Specification, Assessment, and Enforcement of Fairness for Generative AIs
item.description: The risk of reinforcing or exacerbating societal biases and inequalities is growing as generative AI increasingly produces content that resembles human output, from text to images and beyond.

item.title: Causally Inspired Regularization Enables Domain General Representations
item.description: Given a causal graph representing the data-generating process shared across different domains/distributions, enforcing sufficient graph-implied conditional independencies can identify domain-general (non-spurious) feature representations.
